page.title: 15Education Letham.
page.content: Letham Primary School was built in 1890 when it had 2 classrooms divided by a partition. In 1890 it was modernised and the 2 classrooms made into 1. A small library and toilets were added. At the moment, we have a roll of 34. The children come from the surrounding area as follows: The village 16; Collessie 5;Bow of Fife 3; Monimail 1; Fernie 1; Lindores 2; and outlying farms 6. Their means of transport is as follows: 16 walk; 10 use the school bus and 8 come in private cars. There are 2 full time teachers and a part-time teaching auxiliary. Art, Drama and P.E. specialists visit the school. Primary 1-3 are at one end of the area and Primary 4-7 at the other end.
